intro: Matthiola varia subsp. valesiaca, commonly known as the Valesiaca stock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of fragrant, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing shades of white, pink, and purple. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value and ease of cultivation have made it a popular garden plant in temperate climates.
